sampling strategies¶

Synopsis:¶

Here are five sampling strategies to simulate the realistic scenarios:

  • Random sampling

    • random sampling with specific proportion

    • random sampling with specific number

  • Sampling based on the relative position of the building and the collection point

    • north direction

    • south direction

    • west direction

    • east direction

  • Sampling by distance

    • distance between collected point and centroid of building

    • distance within specific buffer of building’s geometry

  • Sampling by time interval

    • extract data at specific time intervals

  • Sampling by grids

    • extract data within different boundaries heights

Functions:¶

Module contains methods for sampling the gnss data

sampling.buffer(gdf, building, x)¶

Sampling the GNSS data through the distance buffer of the building

Parameters

  • gdf (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of all GNSS data(population)

  • building (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of building which contains the geometry of the building(2D)

  • x (int) – distance buffer

Returns

GeoDataFrame of GNSS data after sampling by distance buffer

Return type

GeoDataFrame

sampling.combine_height(listx)¶

Combine three types of heights (lower bound, mid point, upper bound) into one DataFrame

Parameters

listx (list of heights) –

Returns

DataFrame which contains three estimated heights

Return type

lower bound, mid point and upper bound

Sampling the GNSS data by direction that data is in the east of the building

Parameters

  • building (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of building which contains the geometry of the building(2D)

Returns

GeoDataFrame of east GNSS data

Return type

GeoDataFrame

sampling.distance(longitudeA, latitudeA, longitudeB, latitudeB)¶

Calculate distance in meters of point A and point B

Parameters

  • longitudeA (float) – longitude of point A

  • latitudeA (float) – latitude of point A

  • longitudeB (float) – longitude of point B

  • latitudeB (float) – latitude of point B

Returns

Straight line distance in meters between point A and point B

Return type

int

sampling.distance_circles(gdf, x)¶

Sampling the GNSS data by different distances between GNSS receiver points and centroid of building

  • gdf (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of all GNSS data(population)

  • x (int) – distance interval

Returns

GeoDataFrame of GNSS data after sampling by distance interval

Return type

GeoDataFrame

Calculate distances between all GNSS received points and centroid of building

Parameters

  • building (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of building which contains the geometry of the building(2D)

Sampling the GNSS data by grids

gdf (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of all GNSS data(population)

list of each grid which contains all related GNSS data

list

sampling.grid_create(gdf, lon_incre, lat_incre)¶

Create grid based on GNSS data’s geometry and increment of longitude and latitude

Parameters

  • gdf (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of all GNSS data(population)

  • lon_num (int) – number of grid in longitude

  • lat_num (int) – number of grid in latitude

Returns

Two returns: the first one is the GeoDataFrame of whole grids, another is the GeoDataFrame of the intersected grids

Return type

GeoDataFrame

sampling.grid_increment(gdf, x)¶

Obtaining the increment of grid in both longitude and latitude based on the GNSS data’s geometry

Parameters

  • gdf (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of all GNSS data(population)

  • x (int) – grid side length in meters

Returns

increment of grid in longitude and latitude

Return type

int

sampling.random_frac(gdf, x)¶

Sampling the GNSS data randomly by fraction(from 10% to 100% in increments of 10%) of the population

Parameters

  • gdf (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of all GNSS data(population)

  • x (int) – (x+1)/10 is the sampling fraction

Returns

GeoDataFrame after sampling and the length of the new GeoDataFrame is [(x+1)/10]% of population

Return type

GeoDataFrame

sampling.random_row(gdf, x, y)¶

Sampling the GNSS data randomly by entering the specific number of samples

Parameters

  • gdf (GeoDataFrame) – GeoDataFrame of all GNSS data(population)

  • x (int) – x is the interger number of samples

  • y (int) – y is the random seed, different random seeds have the same sample size after random sampling, but the results are different

Returns

GeoDataFrame after sampling and the length of the new GeoDataFrame is the input x

Return type

GeoDataFrame

sampling.rmse(x)¶

Calculate the Root Mean Squared Error

Parameters

  • x (DataFrame) –

  • i (int) – number of samples

Returns

rmse

Return type

list

sampling.sample_size(gdf, x, i)¶

Random sampling of a certain size of the population multiple times

Parameters

  • gdf (GeoDataFrame) –

  • x (int) – size of sample

  • i (int) – number of samples

Returns

list of samples with input size

Return type

list
